div.h2: updates from the head of school

div.class: elementor-element elementor-element-b5cc94a elementor-grid-1 elementor-posts--thumbnail-none elementor-posts--align-left elementor-grid-tablet-2 elementor-grid-mobile-1 elementor-invisible elementor-widget elementor-widget-posts

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-5143 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-covid19 entry

h3.a: Governor Baker Closes Schools in Massachusetts through End of School Year

div.p: Dear Rising Tide Families, At his 12pm press conference today, Governor Baker announced that all Massachusetts schools will remain closed through the end of the school year. While many of us thought this announcement may be coming, I was holding on to hope that we would be able to be all together with our students for at least a short while before the end of the school year. This is

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-5139 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-covid19 entry

h3.a: Ideas for Individual and Family Explorations During Vacation

div.p: Dear Rising Tide Families, Our entire school community has shown tremendous resiliency in adjusting to the challenges of connecting and growing as learners, from a distance. I am proud of our students, our teachers, our staff members, and our families for adapting so well and finding opportunities for growth through these challenges. We have put together a document to support those seeking structures and ideas for April vacation week.

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-5125 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-covid19 entry

h3.a: April 15 Note from Head of School About Advisor Calls and April Vacation

div.p: Dear Rising Tide Families, We continue to make incremental improvements to the COVID-19 and Distance Learning Information for Families page on our website. I encourage you to visit the page if you are looking for resources or clarification of any of the communication we have been sharing through email over the last several weeks. The Community Portal is also an excellent place to find information specific to your child(ren). Advisor Phone Calls this Week Each

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-5065 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-covid19 entry

h3.a: April 11 Update from Head of School

div.p: Dear Rising Tide Families, Thank you to the parents/guardians and students who have already shared feedback on the first week of our updated approach to distance learning. It is tremendously helpful to hear from all of you as we work to improve a balanced approach to teaching and learning through the various challenges that students, families, and our staff members are facing during this unprecedented time. Our school community

article.class: elementor-post elementor-grid-item post-5042 post type-post status-publish format-standard hentry category-covid19 entry

h3.a: Sunday, April 5 Update from Head of School

div.p: Dear Rising Tide Families, After several weeks of communicating by email, I wanted to share a brief video with an overview of our distance learning plan: April 5 Overview of Distance Learning Plan Sincerely,Michael O’KeefeHead of School

div.class: has_eae_slider elementor-element elementor-element-8347459 elementor-column elementor-col-33 elementor-top-column

strong.a: Rising Tide Wellness Team Guidance and Resources for Student Support

p.a: Managing Anxiety & Stress: CDC Guidance on Mental Health during COVID-19

div.p: Family Resources Centers: Provides services to individuals and families impacted by trauma.
Plymouth Family Resources: Parenting support, economic assistance, mental health resources, etc.
InterFace Referral Service: A free, confidential program that helps to connect you with a mental health counselor.
Help Steps 2-1-1 connects individuals to local health and human resources to alleviate disparities in health and social well-being in our community.

p.a: How to apply for MA Health insurance

strong.a: List of Open-Air Walks and Hikes
Rising Tide Wellness Team Guidance and Resources for Student Support

p.a: Massachusetts Department of Elementary and Secondary Education

ul.li: Economic assistance (cash benefits): The Department of Transitional Assistance provides economic assistance to families struggling to make ends meet, including two monthly payments, health insurance and employment support.
State of Massachusetts Unemployment and Workers’ Compensation Programs– For information on unemployment insurance benefits, waivers of certain requirements

p.a: MIAA FAQs about the 2020 Spring Sports Season

div.class: has_eae_slider elementor-element elementor-element-494265f elementor-column elementor-col-33 elementor-top-column

span.strong: Lunch and Breakfast Available Daily During School Closure

li.p: “Grab and go” breakfast and lunch is available each weekday, from 11:30 to 12:30, at Hedge Elementary School and at Indian Brook Elementary School in Plymouth. The meals are being provided, Monday through Friday during the school closure, by the food services of the Plymouth Public Schools, the vendor for school breakfast and lunch at Rising Tide.

Additionally, there are food distribution sites throughout our region during this extended closure for student and family meals. Please refer to Project Bread’s School Closure Meal Information site for locations throughout Massachusetts.

WIC-The Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) provides federal grants to states for supplemental foods, health care referrals, and nutrition education for low-income pregnant, breastfeeding, and non-breastfeeding postpartum women, and to infants and children up to age five who are found to be at nutritional risk.
SNAP Food Assistance– Formerly food stamps. SNAP provides a monthly benefit to buy nutritious foods.
